title: Fat rounded serifs
content:
It's a hand painted awning, wondering if it's hand drawn or a font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HotelMerit_4811.jpg)
author: tdelger

comments.content: I would say that it's hand-painted, based loosely on Cooper Black...

Some substitutes  
Blanchard Inland -- a font from Inland Type foundry circa 1900 -- by Paulo W  
 [http://www.dafont.com/blanchard-inland.font?text=HOTEL+MERIT](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447/http:/www.dafont.com/blanchard-inland.font?text=HOTEL+MERIT "http://www.dafont.com/blanchard-inland.font?text=HOTEL+MERIT")  
WoodStevensBold by Paulo W  
 [http://www.dafont.com/wood-stevens-bold.font?fpp=100&text=HOTEL+MERIT](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447/http:/www.dafont.com/wood-stevens-bold.font?fpp=100&text=HOTEL+MERIT "http://www.dafont.com/wood-stevens-bold.font?fpp=100&text=HOTEL+MERIT")  
Westin Black  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/millertype/westin-black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/millertype/westin-black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/millertype/westin-black/")  
Goudy Heavyface  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/goudy+heavyface/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/goudy+heavyface/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/goudy+heavyface/fonts/")  
Don

The lettering might have been based in part on Buffalo, a popular typeface in the early 20th century by the H.C.Hansen foundry:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831141447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HansenCharsetSM_6718.jpg)
  
Virtually identical typeface sold in Europe as Kolonial. No digital.  
Don
